content.description: An even more radically left variation to taming wolves. Sit start on the far left side of the prow on the jugs at the bottom of the rail. Move right using heel and toe hooks, a peculiar mono, and other forms of wizardry to join back into "Taming Wolves Left". If this has already been done please comment and I will update.
content.protection: 2-5, there is a lot of broken glass
content.location: On the main boulder on the East side of the pond.

content.description: Starts to the left of Taming Wolves deep in the boulder. Links into Taming Wolves after a few moves. Fun problem but the rock can be chossy. The top hold to top out has been broken off but that is not a huge deal. Video of the send but cut off at the end -> youtu.be/tW47JQXsKUU
content.location: On the main boulder of the area, to the left of taming wolves, watch video to be exact

content.description:
Big moves to pretty deep, sharp holds. Two cruxes, in the middle there is a large move to a right hand and topping out is hard without good beta. Rock quality is good but has some choss. In general all of the moves create a fun route which is pretty long (about 12 moves). video for beta -> https://youtu.be/KToo9Qq0vy4

 Update: hold used for topping out has broken off, still a reasonable climb though
content.location: In Indian Rock park, not on the side close to the river, there is a dry pond next to the problem. Impossible to miss from the trail leading to it.

content.description: Starts low on the left side of the small entrance boulder and traverses around to the right side of the boulder and tops out. Video for beta -> https://youtu.be/_TowArpc5zU
content.location: Starts low on the left side of the entrance boulder near parking lot

content.description: Start in the circular hold and after adjusting hands throw upwards and top out. DO NOT use the rock near the ground or any toe hooks, this is to be on the face of the rock only. Video of the send -> https://youtu.be/DNV1uOghJMw
content.location: This is on the smaller boulder near the parking lot, very hard to miss.

content.description: Exact same as Eye of the Rona direct however a toe hook on the left side of the boulder is encouraged to use to adjust hands and reach the top. Video for beta -> youtu.be/X74_zMojlRI
content.location: On the small boulder near the parking lot

content.description: Jugs all the way until a trickier and sandy top out.Video here: youtube.com/watch?v=yfMyzs3…
content.location: Far right side of the main boulder on a huge jug just below the lip.

content.description: Start on the far right of the rock there will be good deep jugs as you make your way right. Good luck finding good foot holds, you have to grab a crimp to the left and then top out.

Located in Salina, KS. One overhung boulder at Indian Rock Park offers routes from v0 to v4ish. Located off of the trail to the base of the bluff, this boulder has been unknown and unclimbed until recently. Some cleaning has been done. Great stop from weary I-70 travelers, best chunk of rock in Kansas.
